name: biomni-quantify-biofilm-biomass-crystal-violet
title: Biomni: Quantify Biofilm Biomass Crystal Violet
description: Quantify biofilm biomass using the crystal violet staining method
content:
Overview

Quantifies bacterial biofilm biomass using the crystal violet staining assay, a widely-used colorimetric method for measuring biofilm formation. Crystal violet dye binds to negatively charged surface molecules and polysaccharides in the biofilm matrix. After solubilization, the absorbance at 570-590 nm correlates directly with biofilm biomass, providing a standardized metric for comparing biofilm-forming capacity across bacterial strains and growth conditions.

Input Parameters

  • absorbance_readings (required): List or array of absorbance values at 570-590 nm from biofilm-containing wells
  • control_wells (required): Absorbance values from negative control wells (no bacteria) for background subtraction
  • sample_names (optional): List of sample identifiers corresponding to each absorbance reading

Input Format

{
  "absorbance_readings": [0.234, 0.289, 0.256, 0.412, 0.398, 0.405],
  "control_wells": [0.045, 0.048, 0.042],
  "sample_names": ["Strain A rep1", "Strain A rep2", "Strain A rep3", "Strain B rep1", "Strain B rep2", "Strain B rep3"]
}

Biological Use Case

Fundamental assay for microbiology research including:

  • Screening bacterial strains for biofilm formation capacity
  • Evaluating antibiofilm compounds and antimicrobial agents
  • Studying environmental factors affecting biofilm development (pH, temperature, nutrients)
  • Characterizing biofilm formation in pathogenic bacteria
  • Assessing efficacy of biofilm dispersal strategies
  • Quality control in medical device and industrial settings
  • Investigating quorum sensing and cell-cell communication in biofilms

Output

Provides quantitative biofilm analysis including:

  • Background-corrected absorbance values for each sample
  • Mean biofilm biomass with standard deviations
  • Statistical comparison between different samples/strains
  • Biofilm formation classification (weak, moderate, strong)
  • Coefficient of variation for replicate assessment
  • Graphical representation of biofilm biomass
  • Comprehensive analysis report (biofilm_quantification_results.txt)

Category

microbiology
